content: Notes: Consider the following points:  The ALLOW_ASUSER_NOPASS_FROM lines allow SMAPI users to issue commands to the Directory Manager by using the ASUSER modifier and the password of that user.  The ASYNCHRONOUS_UPDATE_NOTIFICATION_EXIT lines activate an exit that notifies SMAPI of changes that are made to the user directory. 334 Virtualization Cookbook: Vol 1: IBM z/VM 7.2 10.5.6 Setting up basic SMAPI configuration Complete the following steps on only one SSI member: 1. Log on to MAINT on SSI member 1. 2. Grant authority to the VSMGUARD virtual machine to use certain SFS directories with the following three GRANT commands: ===> grant authority vmsys:vsmwork1. to vsmguard (write newwrite ===> grant authority vmsys:vsmwork1.data to vsmguard (write newwrite ===> grant authority * * vmsys:vsmwork1. to vsmguard (read 3. Access the SFS VMSYS:VSMWORK1 as your F disk in read/write mode: ===> access vmsys:vsmwork1. f (forcerw 4. Edit the file VSMWORK1 AUTHLIST on that disk: ===> x
